com.sorting.components

Class MergeSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sorting.components.AbstractSort
      • com.sorting.components.MergeSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMergeSort, InstrumentationSort

    @Component(value="MergeSort")
 @Qualifier(value="MergeSort")
public class MergeSort
extends AbstractSort
implements IMergeSort
    An implementation of IMergeSort that contains methods for performing merge sort.

    The algorithm uses a divide and conquer algorithm that was invented by John von Neumann in 1945. (MergeSort)

    The algorithm offers O(n log(n)) performance in all cases (worst,average and best case)

    Since:
    March 2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joshua Nwankwo

      • constructRightArray

        public int[] constructRightArray(int midPoint,
                                 int[] arr)
        Will construct the right array based on the midpoint and the parent array. If the length of the parent array is divisible by 2 without a remainder This means the length is an even number and the initial array can be divided into equal parts. However, if it is not divisible by 2 then it is an odd number and an else construction rule is applied.
        Specified by:
        constructRightArray in interface IMergeSort
        Parameters:
        midPoint - the midpoint
        arr - the parent array
        Returns:
        the right array

      • sort

        public int[] sort(int[] arr)
        This is a recursive split operation which will split the left side of the array until it gets to the base case and can no longer be splitted any further. It then propagates to the right array fragment and does the same splitting operation.

        Specified by:
        sort in interface InstrumentationSort
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to be sorted
        Returns:
        the sorted array

      • merge

        public int[] merge(int[] leftArr,

        Specified by:
        merge in interface IMergeSort
        Parameters:
        leftArr - the left array fragment
        rightArr - the right array fragment
        Returns:
        the result of merging both arrays
